message.content:
{"id": "17703", 
"title": "Bug 17703 - Edit/Add Task action should use Workbench dialog as Java Editor does", 
"description": "When executing the 'Add Task' action from the Java editor's ruler context menu, a different dialog is displayed compared to executing the action from the packages view. This inconsistency should be addressed by using the Workbench dialog for the 'Add Task' action in the same way as the Java Editor does.", 
"OB": "When executing the 'Add Task' action from the packages view, the same dialog as the one displayed when executing the action from the Java editor's ruler context menu should be shown.", 
"EB": "When executing the 'Add Task' action from the packages view or the Java editor's ruler context menu, the dialog should be consistent and use the Workbench dialog.", 
"SR": "1. Open the packages view.\n2. Select a CU.\n3. Right-click and select 'File' > 'Add Task'.\n4. Observe that the same dialog as the one shown when executing the action from the Java editor's ruler context menu is displayed."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '17703', 'title': 'Bug 17703EditAdd Task action should use Workbench dialog as Java Editor does', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Bug 17703EditAdd Task action should use Workbench dialog as Java Editor does ', 'SR': 'F1 select CU in packages view execute FileAdd Taskobserve: you get a different dialog than executing the action from theJava editors ruler context menu '}
